action.action-desc: Mr. Good of Virginia (for himself, Mr. Duncan, Mr. Posey, Mr. Biggs, and Mr. Moore of Alabama) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide that an alien who has been convicted of a crime is ineligible for asylum, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Asylum for Criminals Act of 2023.

section.header: Aliens convicted of crimes ineligible for asylum
section.text: Clause (ii) of section 208(b)(2) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1158) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by amending clause (ii) of subparagraph (A) to read as follows:

clause.text: except as provided in subparagraph (B), the alien has been finally convicted of a crime;

paragraph.text: by amending subparagraph (B) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The Secretary of Homeland Security may designate by regulation political offenses committed outside the United States that will be not considered to be a crime described in clause (ii). The authority under this subparagraph is limited to political offenses committed outside the United States.
